commit.message:
core: let destroyed window go through the preprocess loop one last time

Some necessary damage calculation happens there. For example, if a
window was rendered last frame but is destroyed this frame, the
preprocess loop should add the window to damage. If the destroyed window
is freed before the preprocess loop, that damage will be missed.

Fixes #1229
Fixes: 3b6e003ca1212ba348f8ad9ca01fb576d5aff737

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 48c7f0827673c082a41abf0ee5bcf1fa22319d74
parent a5e3de4489ce33726516809e172e9ae5e018334c

committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1712022372 +0100

The child might have had WM_STATE add to it before we can subscribe to
property change events, so we have to check.

commit.message:
win: make sure we keep track of existing subwins when managing a toplevel

At the point when we started to listen for a toplevel's substructure
events, it might already have subwins. So we must query its existing
children and keep track of them.

This also means we don't care about subwins of an unmanaged window
anymore as when it becomes managed we will query that anyways.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree a2d56d747ea23907cb8e6bb5153d8325bb047559
parent c59848e4be02f683ac3b31efa2899cf065bc1280
author Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711475016 +0000
committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711475223 +0000

win: make sure we keep track of existing subwins when managing a toplevel

At the point when we started to listen for a toplevel's substructure
events, it might already have subwins. So we must query its existing
children and keep track of them.

This also means we don't care about subwins of an unmanaged window
anymore as when it becomes managed we will query that anyways.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

commit.message:
event: fix some cases where client stale is set unnecessarily

1. If window is reparented to the same parent, don't mark its current
   toplevel stale.
2. If window is reparented to a toplevel that already has a client
   window, don't mark the toplevel stale.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 0ab87bdad82f50959c0e1373a786669bab99ed3f

event: fix some cases where client stale is set unnecessarily

1. If window is reparented to the same parent, don't mark its current
   toplevel stale.
2. If window is reparented to a toplevel that already has a client
   window, don't mark the toplevel stale.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

commit.message:
dbus: make cdbus a bit more self-contained

cdbus_init/destroy no longer modifies struct session, instead they
returns the created struct cdbus_data and let the caller deal with it.

Also store the mainloop in cdbus_data, so the DBusWatch callbacks can
access it. We use to pass the whole `struct session` for the mainloop
and cdbus_data, but now we no longer set `cdbus_data` in `struct
session`, so we have to pass the `cdbus_data` as user data to the
DBusWatch callbacks, which means it has to contain the mainloop.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree b690450817a6956ee7269439012597aadbf05d57
parent d22d2f5b5eaad2df3d9b84dae016f77a774fde3e
author Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711222062 +0000
committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711456811 +0000

dbus: make cdbus a bit more self-contained

cdbus_init/destroy no longer modifies struct session, instead they
returns the created struct cdbus_data and let the caller deal with it.

Also store the mainloop in cdbus_data, so the DBusWatch callbacks can
access it. We use to pass the whole `struct session` for the mainloop
and cdbus_data, but now we no longer set `cdbus_data` in `struct
session`, so we have to pass the `cdbus_data` as user data to the
DBusWatch callbacks, which means it has to contain the mainloop.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

commit.message:
dbus: major refactor

Invert the control flow, so we don't need to send the dbus connection
all the way down to leaf functions, instead they return back the dbus
message we need to send. Get rid of all those cdbus_reply_* functions.

And better function names, and other minor things.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 5889b7b72eab945cb7a32d6e8f37e8767158e3d6
parent 6b066728bfc484f616c243d191d527db91c0d3f0
author Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711218725 +0000
committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711456808 +0000

dbus: major refactor

Invert the control flow, so we don't need to send the dbus connection
all the way down to leaf functions, instead they return back the dbus
message we need to send. Get rid of all those cdbus_reply_* functions.

And better function names, and other minor things.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

commit.message:
event: delayed handling of reparent notifies

We used to fetch the WM_STATE property in event handler, but we should
only do that inside the critical section. With this commit we keep a
list of all subwins (direct children of toplevels), and keep track of
their WM_STATE properties, only fetching it in critical section when
needed.

Stop changing event masks in win_mark/unmark_client, since that's
entirely managed by the subwins now.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 06bbe0cbfce2068add4632e0757de4238e68935f
parent 54fb0c7ac045114255b3176031ec17908d049efd
author Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711389946 +0000
committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711455779 +0000

event: delayed handling of reparent notifies

We used to fetch the WM_STATE property in event handler, but we should
only do that inside the critical section. With this commit we keep a
list of all subwins (direct children of toplevels), and keep track of
their WM_STATE properties, only fetching it in critical section when
needed.

Stop changing event masks in win_mark/unmark_client, since that's
entirely managed by the subwins now.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

commit.message:
core: let's not do ancestry lookups

Always assume WM frames are direct children of the root window, and
client windows are direct children of their respective frames. Also WM
frames must have a one-to-one relationship with client windows.

We already assume this in most places, but it's inconsistent. Let's make
this assumption official. If something breaks we can then figure out a
principled way of dealing with that. Instead of having things "happen to
work" which is the situation now.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 9231675f681b939aba04d6fb3bd7240ccf00173e
parent 21777fce05db21791c7627383f2e8608591c997f
author Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711331051 +0000
committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711453461 +0000

core: let's not do ancestry lookups

Always assume WM frames are direct children of the root window, and
client windows are direct children of their respective frames. Also WM
frames must have a one-to-one relationship with client windows.

We already assume this in most places, but it's inconsistent. Let's make
this assumption official. If something breaks we can then figure out a
principled way of dealing with that. Instead of having things "happen to
work" which is the situation now.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

commit.message:
win: restructure window states

Remove transitional window states, such as UNMAPPING, MAPPING, etc. We
are trying to generialize animation, keeping all those states for
animation/fading will only make things more complicated. Instead the
window state now exactly reflect how the window is to the X server, and
we check the animatable states to determine the animation progress.

Signed-off-by: Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com>

tree 16b666dc37c314082137a61ad621b40bf47408b6
parent 4b3688ddecfdab36d22743c3c9dd09d6828d0dc6
author Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711075308 +0000
committer Yuxuan Shui <yshuiv7@gmail.com> 1711452968 +0000

win: restructure window states

are trying to generialize animation, keeping all those states for
animation/fading will only make things more complicated. Instead the
window state now exactly reflect how the window is to the X server, and
we check the animatable states to determine the animation progress.
